oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of two American soldiers peering from a "pup-tent"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The "pup-tent" was first used by American soldiers in the Civil War. The tent consisted of two sections which buttoned together. Each soldier carried one half of the tent. By the time of WWI, the shelter tent was made of a tan colored canvas. This photo was most likely taken at Camp Sevier, South Carolina, the assembly point for National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas that became the 30th Division. The Still Image belonged to Sgt. Ernest West, Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div.
